name: Lucy

topics.topic: DoctorAddictionI think I might be addicted to something.
topics.topic_text: I think I might be addicted to something. Can you help?
topics.response_text: I swear, you and Zip, just full of your own little chemical problems, aren't you?

topics.topic_text: I think I'll tough it out.
topics.response_text: Your call, mungo.

topics.topic_text: I don't have 50 caps.
topics.response_text: I suppose if you can't afford treatment, maybe you can't afford your next fix. So that works out, doesn't it?

topics.topic: DoctorMedicalI'm hurt. I need help, Doc.
topics.topic_text: Can I get some medical treatment?
topics.response_text: That takes a lot of nerve, threatening to bury us all alive and then crawling to me for help. As RJ would say, "Fuck off, mungo."

topics.topic_text: Sure, fine.
topics.response_text: Okay, now hold still.

topics.topic_text: Sure, fine.
topics.response_text: Hold on, this is going to ouch a bit.

topics.topic_text: Sure, fine.
topics.response_text: This is going to hurt, so you'd better not start crying.

topics.topic: DoctorMedicalNOOn second thought, I'll be fine.
topics.topic_text: At those prices, I'll take care of myself.
topics.response_text: Fine. Less of my supplies you're using up.

topics.topic_text: GREETING
topics.response_text: Okay, you should be fine, and ready to run off and play.{Just woken up.}

topics.topic_text: How do you keep healthy here?
topics.response_text: There's always one big sister or another who knows her way around a compress and a sewing needle, so we take care of most of the little scrapes.

topics.topic_text: So, you're the only doctor in this whole place?
topics.response_text: Well, we all know the basics. Combat first aid, you know? But I've got the most experience at the tough stuff.

topics.topic_text: That sounds like it's pretty useful fungus.
topics.response_text: It is, especially for dealing with the low-level radiation we all get from the water. The fungus just soaks it right up.

topics.topic_text: That's all I need to know for now.
topics.response_text: Well, until you come asking for a bandage, at least.

topics.topic_text: Where can I find a doctor?
topics.response_text: Yeah, that's me. I'm only on duties when I'm in the office.{A little irritated}

topics.topic_text: Can you give me directions?
topics.response_text: Well, where to?

topics.topic_text: I'm a guest in town. Mayor MacCready let me in for rescuing your friends.
topics.response_text: You saved Penny and Sammy and Squirrel? I can see why RJ let you in! Thanks, for all of us!

topics.topic_text: I rescued those captured kids. I'm a big hero.
topics.response_text: You brought back Penny and Sammy and Squirrel? Well, I guess that does make you a pretty big hero. Thanks!{Emphasis on "You"}

topics.topic_text: I've got Buffout to trade for fungus.
topics.response_text: Excellent. I should be able to synthesize the proteins from this into something that'll fight rickets. Here's your fungus in return.

topics.topic_text: What do you know about Vault 87?
topics.response_text: That's where the monsters come from. We don't go back there. It's called Murder Pass for a reason, you know?{condescending}

topics.topic_text: Why does everyone call me a mungo?
topics.response_text: It means an adult. We don't really see many of you around, and we're glad of it.

topics.topic_text: Do you know anything about some android who needed a surgeon?
topics.response_text: Oh yeah! That crazy old story about an escaped robot, right? He was looking for a surgeon and a computer expert. Yeah, that sounds right.

topics.topic_text: What do you know about this android from the Commonwealth?
topics.response_text: Oh you mean that old "android recording?" Have you heard it? It's great. Here's a spare copy of that old holotape. It's either real or a great joke.{excited}

topics.topic_text: Ever do any facial surgery? Maybe on someone from the Commonwealth?
topics.response_text: Oh if I got my hands on the right gear I might try it. It's dangerous though. Prone to infection. Reminds me of an old hoax. Listen to this holotape.

topics.topic_text: You ever do a face job on an android from the North? <Jingle purse of 100 caps.>
topics.response_text: Oh if I got my hands on the right gear I might try it. It's dangerous though. Prone to infection. Reminds me an old hoax. Listen to this holotape.

topics.topic_text: A patient of mine needs a facial epidermal augmentation. You ever perform one?
topics.response_text: Oh if I got my hands on the right gear I might try it. It's dangerous though. Prone to infection. Reminds me an old hoax. Listen to this holotape.

topics.topic_text: You know who might have a Lipoplasticator or Micro Dermal Graftilizer?
topics.response_text: Guess old Pinkerton at Rivet City has some shiny prewar tech. He might have what you're looking for.

topics.topic_text: Here's 100 caps for the locale of a Lipoplasticator or Micro Dermal Graftilizer.
topics.response_text: Guess old Pinkerton at Rivet City has some shiny prewar tech. He might have what you're looking for.

topics.topic_text: I need to find a Micro Dermal Graftilizer for epidermal augmentation surgery.
topics.response_text: Guess old Pinkerton at Rivet City has some shiny prewar tech. He might have what you're looking for.

topics.topic_text: SpeechChallengeFailure
topics.response_text: Mmm. Let's talk about something else.{considering, then brushing off the question pretending she was never asked a question.}

conversation.topic_text: I'll let you get back to work.
conversation.response_text: Thanks. Hopefully, it'll just be skinned knees and bloody noses, today.
I don't know why RJ's letting you back in, but if you touch any of my kids, I'll make sure you never have any of your own.
You know it, Eclair. Keeping the masses fed?
Make it quick, Knock Knock.{A little harried}
Yeah, yeah, great story.{A little harried}
Joseph, can I ask you a question?
I've been seeing a few cases of bent bones and weak teeth in some of the younger ones. Any clue in those books about what it could be?
Great, so they just need to eat more? I'm sure Eclair will be thrilled to hear that.{Very sarcastic}
Thanks, Joseph. I think that's all I need.
Hold still, you big baby.
So, how's everything going, big, scary, mayor-man?{Teasing}
I'm still seeing the same sorts of cases. Stubbed toes, bloody noses, a few stabbings. We could really use more medicine, though.{Teasing}
Sure, fine.{Curt, and a little angry}
Nothing much, RJ. One nearly lost an eye - said they thought it would look cool. I patched him up and smacked him on the head for being an idiot.
Oh, probably because MacCready likes me more than he likes you. That seems like a good reason to me!{Mocking and mean}
Heya. Are you feeling alright? You look a little stiff.
Busy, like always. Somebody's always got a tummy ache or a runny nose or a knife wound. You know how it is.
Hee hee! Okay, later then!{giggling laughter, like at a dirty joke}
Hello, there. What're you up to? Not getting into too much trouble?
Keeping everyone from killing themselves. Same as ever.

description:
Lucy is a 11 year-old Hispanic Female.

A young and talented doctor who serves the children of Little Lamplight. Despite her age, Lucy has mastered practical medicine and runs the clinic in the office building with a dedication that impresses even the most skeptical residents.

Lucy's Personality: Caring, dedicated, and mature beyond her years. Lucy takes her role as the community's doctor seriously, but still maintains a childlike sense of wonder and humor. She is particularly protective of Mayor MacCready, whose life she saved, and looks up to Red as a mentor and older sister.

Lucy's Backstory: Born and raised in Little Lamplight, Lucy showed an early aptitude for medicine. Under the tutelage of Red, the community's former doctor, Lucy quickly mastered the practical skills needed to treat injuries and illnesses in the harsh wasteland environment. Her talent was undeniable when, at just seven years old, she successfully treated Mayor MacCready after a cave-in trapped him. Since that day, she has served as Little Lamplight's official doctor, running the clinic in the office building where a banner from the pre-War Peanuts comic strip hangs above the entrance, reading "The doctor is in."
